result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Q Yates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  May Not have contact with co-deft, victim and Woodman's Store.  While on probaiton - DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jodi Meier.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $655.  Deft has paid restitution upfront.  

Count 2 - deft sentenced to 10yrs WSP; initial confinement of 5yrs followed by yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or ERP.  Deft taken into custody forthwith.

Count 3 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3yrs consecutive to count 2.  Probation conditions are the same as the ES conditions.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jodi Meier.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater on each count.  Remaining counts are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 3/2/16 @ 1:30pm.
